title: Discord- The Tyrannic Pirate (@Maraudaur)
body:
Welp, i was listening to music, was thinking of bilgewater and how there isntmany pirate champions and i just came up with this

Passive- Linker
Discord Links Two Nearby Champions His other abilities have effects when passing through the link

Q- Ricochet-Cooldown 15/13/10/7/5 seconds Mana-10/20/30/35/40
Discord fires three shots from his blunderbuss ricocheting off walls and enemy champions hit to a limit of 3 ricochets dealing 20-30-40-50-60 AD damage+30% (ad scaling) and discord gains a stack of Blunder
Linker Effect- Discord gains 1/2/3/4/5% of missing health per ricochet
W- Blunder-cooldown 20/15/10 seconds mana 50/75/85
Discord shoots a shot from his blunderbuss at a target enemy champion dealing 5-10-15-20-25 damage per second, discord consumes his stacks of blunder healing for 10-20-30-40-50 per stack of discord +(1/2/3/4/5% of his max health) 
Blunders effects double if the shot passes through the link
E- Submerge cooldown- 50/40/30/20/10 seconds mana 100/120/150/160/180
Discord uses his power of the water to summon a water spring which taunts nearby enemies and neutral monsters when attacked the water spring deals 5/10/20 (+10/20/40% of bonus ad) ad damage nearby the spring
R-Face Me Sea's! cooldown 90-60-30 seconds mana 125/150/175
Discord summons up a huge water spring knocking up all enemies and slowing them for (50/70/90%) and increasing all damage dealt by discord by 25/50/75%

Discord can now link up to 3/4/5 nearby enemies


Stats
Hp 365 (+23 per level)

all other stats would be zero

I am developing a lore at the current time  but all i know is that he is a pirate captain, is linked to Tf Graves mf and gp and he has a magical ability  to control water so a little easter egg is he secretly gets 1+ movement speed when in the river

Well I have connections and message maraudaur personally :D

I get the idea of his skills but i feel like that the passive, E and ultimate are a bit out of place; with the Q and W you can kind of picture a pirate dude on say like Bot lane (assuming this is an ADC?) shooting his pistols at everyone he sees but then all of a sudden he's summoning water springs to knock people up and taunt them like a support or something like that. But then you add the effects the passive gives, you almost get the vibe that he's a solo laner, like mid/top. It's a bit hard to get a picture of what role he would be assigned too because of the variation of the skills. 

But overall the idea of his Q is cool and i think if the W maybe had 2 parts may be better, like the bit where he shoots and then it does damage over time as a passive then have an active which is where he consumes his blunder. The concept of the E and R would be cool too see on some kind of support but i just don't feel that they fit with the rest of his skills, and the passive seems a bit odd too. 

Try to think about what role he should take on, base your the kit around that and try to get something that feels smooth and right together just to avoid an identity crisis. 

-Yasho {{champion:240}}

he is a jungler toplaner, someone meant to be going arround the map,  see his water abilities is so he can control the fight,  his abilites are meant for manipulating his oponents but i get where you are coming from, but i see pirates, so they have alot of stuff in common with water, maybe he got enchanted or something, his q and e are meant to work with zone control hje is meant to fit the control jungle play theme while still being a relevant threat in team fights
and i did try to do that xD

Yeah so I agree with some of Yasho's points. 

The main thing is you need to think of a cohesive theme. What core fantasy are you trying to deliver?

So your core thing is you want it to be Bilgewatery/pirate - It would be great for you to be a bit more specific (what kind of pirate? Gritty like GP?, Kinda goofy like Pirates of the carribean?)

Then you need to think about the abilities you put in.

The passive links - How does this deliver on the fantasy of being a pirate?
The Q and W seem alright but very similar to GP Q

E and R suddenly makes this guy a water bender (like Yasho says) how does this sell the fantasy of your kind of pirate? (if this is a good representation does that make Q and W out of place?).

Also jsut a note the link thing is cool it just doesnt seem to fit. It also looks like E and R hardly have any interaction with the Link system.

I think its important to think about the core fantasy your character fits. Then build from there.

But yeah I think the Link mechanics are unique and cool, maybe just doesnt really fit a pirate theme.
